definition: cat/CL:隻|只[zhi1]/(dialect) to hide oneself/(coll.) modem

sentences.english: Cat waist slowly hikes to unlock later decease on the emperor sky.
sentences.chinese: 猫腰，慢慢的走在帝天释的身后。

sentences.english: Sometimes we had to crawl along, sometimes we had to wade knee-deep through water and mud.
sentences.chinese: 我们时而猫腰而行，时而涉过水深及膝的泥浆。

definition: to lean forward/to lean out (of a window, door etc)
to bow/to bend at the waist
(to move or do sth) softly and quietly (idiom)
to take to one's heels/to scram
like a wisp of smoke/(to disappear etc) in an instant
to run like the wind/to rush/to gallop
to walk on tiptoe/to step on sb's foot/to join (a trade, profession etc)/to associate with (a certain group of people)
to get into/to dig into (studies, job etc)/to squeeze into
